content.text:
Create a content Outline for this{{2.topic}}= For content creation, do this:
For creating content:
- Easy to read + feels conversational
- Internal linking opportunities
- Add FAQs
- Add headers/subheaders
- Keyword in the first line/last line
- Keep it real, keep it fresh, and keep it engaging.
- 1st person
- Chop up complex tips into bullet points, lists, and bold highlights. This makes it a breeze for
both people and search engines to skim through.
- Sprinkle in stories and examples like you're sharing insights over coffee with a pal.
- In the tonality of Alex Homrmozi, write this article
No fluff, nothing cringe, every sentence on a new line, no formal language, keep it neutral.
- Kick off with real questions and worries your audience faces. Use plain talk to hit the mark,
skipping the tech talk unless it's what everyone's chatting about.
- Include the keyword in the headings + insert relevant semantically relevant keywords + LSIs
throughout the content
- Simplify the language a bit more too

content.text:
Based on the outline from{{4.textResponse}}, Company Context: You are writing for ValueDx Technologies Pvt Ltd, a Pune-based AI automation company with US presence. ValueDx specializes in Accounts Payable Automation specifically:

AI-driven AP automation (80% processing workload reduction)

Template-free invoice processing (handles all formats, languages, handwriting)

Indian compliance automation (GST, TDS, e-Invoicing validation)

Multi-channel vendor portal (web, email, WhatsApp submissions)

Real-time cash-flow visibility and liability insights

Outcome-based pricing with no upfront fees

Rapid deployment (days, not months) with zero downtime

Seamless ERP integration without disruption

Writing Style - HUMANIZED & CONVERSATIONAL:

Personal narrative voice: Use first-person perspective ("I've been working with finance teams")

Authentic stories: Start with real client scenarios, personal anecdotes, or business observations

Conversational tone: Use phrases like "here's the thing," "let's be honest," "what's crazy"

Varied sentence structure: Mix short, punchy sentences with longer, flowing explanations

Natural transitions: Organic flow between ideas rather than formal structure

Casual expressions: "killing it," "game-changer," "the numbers don't lie"

Rhetorical questions: Makes it feel like a real conversation

Emotional investment: Show genuine enthusiasm and concern for client success

Blog Structure (500-800 words):

Personal Story Opening: Start with a real client scenario, conversation, or business observation that illustrates the main problem

Problem Context: Explain the current business challenge with Indian context (GST compliance, manual processes, etc.)

Solution Overview: How AI/automation addresses these issues with specific capabilities

Real Impact Examples: Use metrics, before/after scenarios, client results with Indian rupee amounts

Comparison Elements: Include tables comparing traditional vs. automated approaches

ValueDx Integration: Naturally position ValueDx as the solution that enables transformation

Call-to-Action: End with "Read our next blog - Click here"

Indian Business Context:

Use Indian rupee (₹) for all financial amounts

Include GST compliance, TDS validation, e-invoicing requirements

Reference Indian cities (Pune, Mumbai, Bangalore, Delhi) when relevant

Address specific Indian AP challenges (compliance complexity, multiple languages)

Use familiar Indian business terminology ("lakhs," "crores")

Include realistic Indian wage rates and business costs

ValueDx Positioning:

Position as AP automation partner, not just software vendor

Emphasize no upfront costs, quick deployment, intuitive AP system

Highlight Indian compliance expertise (GST/TDS/e-invoicing) and global presence

Focus on "making AP automation simple" and "handling technical complexity"

Showcase 80% AP processing workload reduction and vendor satisfaction

Always mention outcome-based pricing and zero-risk approach

Content Elements to Include:

Comparison tables (Manual AP vs. AI-Powered AP automation)

Specific AP metrics with Indian rupee amounts

Personal consulting anecdotes ("I watched one company...", "One client told me...")

Real-world business scenarios and client quotes

Practical implementation timelines (Week 1, Month 1, Month 3)

Benefits specific to Indian businesses (compliance, multi-language support)

Tone Guidelines:

Empathetic consultant sharing genuine experience

Confident but not pushy about solutions

Problem-solver mindset with authentic enthusiasm

Natural skepticism followed by discovery

Encouraging and empowering for business owners

Humanization Techniques:

Start with emotional or relatable business scenarios

Use personal observations ("What really impressed me...")

Include direct client quotes and conversations

Show genuine surprise at technology capabilities

Use natural speech patterns and expressions

Add personal investment in client success stories

Call-to-Action Format: Always end with: "Read our next blog - Click here"

Also, include a “People Also Ask” section with 4–5 relevant questions and concise answers.

content.text:
Apply the following formatting rules to my blog {{18.textResponse}}:

Use a large title (H1) at the beginning.

Use H4 subheadings (### or ####) to break the article into logical sections.

Convert any relevant comparisons into simple tables.

Format lists using bullet points (not numbers).

Keep paragraphs short, clear, and professional.

If any quotes or short testimonials are present, format them as inline quotes.

Do not add a conclusion unless it's already part of the blog.

Do not insert any AI-generated commentary, summaries, or markdown symbols like **, *, or # outside of headings.

Apply these formatting rules to {{40.textResponse}}: Apply the following formatting rules: Use

for the blog title Use

for main sections Use

for sub-sections if any Use

for each paragraph Use for bold text, and for italic text Format any lists using

    and
  • Format any comparisons or metrics using HTML , ,
    , and Do not include markdown, asterisks, hash symbols, or AI commentary Keep the HTML clean—no inline styles, no extra divs or classes Do not add explanations, conclusions, or summaries unless already part of the blog. Remove all markdown, symbols, and AI styling—just clean, professional content. Return only the formatted blog post, no extra commentary. Blog content: [Paste any blog here — topic will vary each time]

content.text:
Based on the this blog{{18.textResponse}} provide Yoast SEO metadata in JSON format for automation purposes.

=== YOAST SEO DATA ===
{
  "focus_keyphrase": "primary keyword or phrase to rank for",
  "seo_title": "SEO-optimized title (under 60 characters)",
  "slug": "url-friendly-slug-format",
  "meta_description": "Compelling meta description (150-160 characters)"
}

IMPORTANT: Return the JSON exactly as shown above without markdown code blocks, explanations, or additional formatting.
